summary: The client expressed concerns about discrepancies in vision and requirements during SP-001 execution and requested a reset to re-run the same stories. The SPRINT_PLANNING_ARCHITECT (Mike) proposed creating SP-002 to re-execute US-010, US-015, and US-001 with updated specifications, ensuring Mac compatibility and local SQLite setup, and offered to handle the reset and sprint save upon approval.

decisions.title: Re-execute SP-001 stories in new sprint
decisions.details: Pull US-010, US-015, and US-001 into SP-002 for regeneration based on current vision and requirements, without full backlog reset.

actions.task: Approve or tweak SP-002 proposal (e.g., add US-016 or change sprint ID)
Reset statuses to Backlog, save SP-002, and update stories to In Sprint if approved

backlog_deltas.title: Reset status from Done to Backlog for re-execution in SP-002
Reset status from Done to Backlog for re-execution in SP-002
Reset status from Done to Backlog for re-execution in SP-002
Create new sprint with US-010, US-015, US-001 for re-execution

risks.risk: Leftover artifacts from SP-001 execution (e.g., old SQLite db files) may interfere with re-execution
risks.mitigation: Use US-016 setup script to wipe and reseed the environment before running SP-002
